thread.title: Ten-year-old boy dies after Topshop 'store furniture incident'
thread.title_full: Ten-year-old boy dies after Topshop 'store furniture incident'

author: Kate Solomon
title: Ten-year-old boy dies after Topshop 'store furniture incident'
text:
The incident took place in a Topshop store in Reading [Geoff Moore/REX/Shutterstock] More A ten-year-old boy has died after an incident at a branch of Topshop in Reading, where he sustained serious head injuries. The boy, who has not been named, was visiting the popular clothing shop at the Oracle shopping centre in Reading on the first day of half term. It’s not clear exactly what happened, but reports indicate that some store furniture was involved. Unconfirmed reports suggest that the boy may have pulled a barrier down in the shop, as reported by The Mirror . MORE: Examiner tries to SUE learner for ‘braking too quickly’ during driving test He was taken to the Royal Berkshire Hospital after being injured yesterday at around 4.15pm; his injuries were life-threatening and he died at the hospital just an hour after the incident, according to Thames Valley Police. Police also said that the boy’s next of kin had been informed and, although the death is being treated as non-suspicious, further investigation will take place. Ambulance outside of @OracleReading and @topmanUK closed and cordoned off. Police and shop security also present. pic.twitter.com/6eCad9d1I2 
— Joe (@JOEaRKay) February 13, 2017 The statement from Thames Valley Police explains, “We were called by the South Central Ambulance Service… to a retail store at the Oracle shopping centre, Reading. “On attendance they found that a 10-year-old boy had suffered serious head injuries after an incident involving store furniture. “At this time the death is being treated as unexplained but non-suspicious and police are making further inquiries.” Reblog
